content.query:
-- This is auto-generated code
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE, 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS [result]

-- HEADER_ROW set to TRUE, Row and Field terminators set
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE, 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS [result]


-- Examine the data types for the columns
EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv'',
        FORMAT = ''CSV'',
        PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]'

-- GENERIC 8000 VARCHAR LENGTH IS TOO MUCH.
-- LETS CHECK THE MAXIMUM LENGHT OF THE VALUES.
SELECT
    MAX(LEN(LocationID)) AS len_LocationId,
    MAX(LEN(Borough)) AS len_Borough,
    MAX(LEN(Zone)) AS len_Zone,
    MAX(LEN(service_zone)) AS len_service_zone
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE, 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS [result]


-- THE RESULTS FROM PREVIOUS QUERY RETURN SHORTER MAX VALUES
-- WE MUST LOW COST AND OPTIMIZE QUERIES
-- Use WITH clause to provide explicit data types
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE, 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    ) AS [result]
    

-- LET´S CHECK IF THE SPECIFIED DATA TYPES ARE THE TYPES OF DATA THAT SYNAPSIS USES
EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv'',
        FORMAT = ''CSV'',
        PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE, 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = '','',
        ROWTERMINATOR = ''\n''
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    ) AS [result]'
-- WE´D VERIFIED GETTING ADJUSTED LENGTHS TO CHARVAR VALUES
-- ADJUSTING THE RIGHTS AMOUNTS OF DATA, MEMORY AND COSTS


-- FINDING THE RIGHT COLLATION FOR DATABASE
SELECT name, collation_name FROM sys.databases;
-- WE GET LATIN, NOT UTF. WE SHOULD APPLY THE RIGHT COLLATION
-- LETS BEGIN SPECIFYIN PER FIELD, NOT ALL THE DATABASE
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE, 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8,
        Zone VARCHAR(50) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8,
        Zone VARCHAR(50) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8
    ) AS [result]


-- SECOND CASE APPLY DE COLLATION TO ALL THE DATABASE
CREATE DATABASE nyc_taxi_discovery;

USE nyc_taxi_discovery;

ALTER DATABASE nyc_taxi_discovery COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8;

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE, 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    ) AS [result]
-- AT THIS POINT WE ARE NOT GETTING ERROR USING nyc_taxi_discovery DATABASE
-- IF WE CHANGE THE DATABASE WE WILL STILL GET ERRORS


-- SELECT ONLY SUBSET OF COLUMNS
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE, 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50)
    ) AS [result]


-- READ DATA FROM A FILE WITHOUT HEADERS
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    )
    WITH (
        Borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        Zone VARCHAR(50) 3
    )
AS [result]


--FIX COLUMN NAMES, MARKING DIFFERENT COLUMN NAMES AND IGNORING HEADER REGISTRIES
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        FIRSTROW = 2, -- MARKS THE LINE WHERE THE DATA BEGINS 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
    ) AS [result]


-- DEBUGGING ERROR FROM CHANGING ZONE VARCHAR TO (5). 
-- WE CHANGE PARSER_VERSION TO 1 IN ORDER TO EASY DEBUGGING. IT WILL MARK THE ERROR PROPERLY. 
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '1.0',
        FIRSTROW = 2, -- MARKS THE LINE WHERE THE DATA BEGINS 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        --zone VARCHAR(5) 3,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
    ) AS [result]


-- LETS CREATE AN EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE BASE ON abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/zona_de_taxi.csv
-- WE ARE CREATING THE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE IN THE nyc_taxi_discovery DATABASE, NOT THE MASTER
CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data -- WE POINT TO DATA CONTAINER
WITH (
    LOCATION = 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/' 
)

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'raw/zona_de_taxi.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '1.0',
        FIRSTROW = 2, -- MARKS THE LINE WHERE THE DATA BEGINS 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
    ) AS [result]

-- LETS CREATE ANOTHER EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE
CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data_raw
WITH (
    LOCATION = 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsecoursedltfm.dfs.core.windows.net/raw' 
)

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'zona_de_taxi.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '1.0',
        FIRSTROW = 2, -- MARKS THE LINE WHERE THE DATA BEGINS 
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
    ) AS [result]

-- DROP A DATA SOURCE
DROP EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data;

-- CHECK DATA SOURCE
SELECT name, location FROM sys.external_data_sources;
